quotes.quote: God will hold sinners with one hand over the pit of hell, while He torments them with the other.
He who doesn't sin, is the greatest sinner of all.
One leak will sink a ship: and one sin will destroy a sinner.
The worst sinner has a future, even as the greatest saint has had a past. No one is so good or bad as he imagines.
We're all sinners. Everybody you meet all over the world is a sinner.
It is right to hate sin, but not to hate the sinner.
There is no sinner like a young saint.
The sinner will not confess, nor will the priest receive his confession, if the veil of secrecy is removed.
If you're going to be a sinner, be the best sinner on the block.
Even the righteous man is just a sinner living in between sins.
Sinners cannot obey the gospel, any more than the law, without renewal of heart.
The tear of the sinner is more beloved to God than the arrogance of the righteous man.
Be a sinner and sin strongly, but more strongly have faith and rejoice in Christ.
A sinner can no more repent and believe without the Holy Spirit's aid than he can create a world.
Sinners are attractive because they are loved; they are not loved because they are attractive.
More sinners are cursed at not because we despise their sins but because we envy their success at sinning.
The only difference between the saint and the sinner is that every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future.
Sinners think they are saints, but saints know they are sinners.
When a sinner has any just sense of his condition, as alienated from a holy God, he will not be apt to think of the unpardonable sin.
We're all just a bunch of sinners, but we do the best we can.
Better to be known as a sinner than a hypocrite.
Only the sinner has the right to preach.
No sinner is ever saved after the first twenty minutes of a sermon.
There are only two kinds of men: the righteous who think they are sinners and the sinners who think they are righteous.
There is no sin, no crime, no evil, God cannot forgive.
Wherever there are sinners, the weak, the sorrowful, the poor in the world, that is where God goes.
The sinner sins against himself; the wrongdoer wrongs himself, becoming the worse by his own action.
The first and greatest punishment of the sinner is the conscience of sin.
The only thing different between sinners and saints is one is forgiven and the other ain't.
Only the sinner has a right to preach.
